section.name: Bluefin is an Open Source (internal), PayPal Community Project
section.p: Would you like to get directly involved with the Bluefin project? Perhaps you or your team members would like to contribute to the next release? If so, please contact Tom Gilmour or Deepak Paldano Deli . Participation can happen on a sprint by sprint basis, and you decide what you'll commit to. We have a variety of roles you can choose from User, Contributor, Developer, Admin, Trainer, Evangelist.

subsection.name: Contribution Roles
subsection.p: We have defined four types of contribution roles, which also correlate to the level of source code access one has.

ul.li: (default) read-only access to all Bluefin core source
read access to all Bluefin core source
read/write access to branches prefixed with "patch-"
Essentially, contributors have access to submit patches to Bluefin core.
read/write access to all Bluefin core source
read-only access to branches and tags prefixed with "v_"
Developers are expected to review patch contributions as well as the work of other developers
read/write access to all Bluefin core source.
Admins are expected to review all contributions, perform merges once contributions are accepted, do releases, and administer the GIT repository including provisioning access requests
